metadata.title: CVE-2024-27067 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:xen/evtchn: avoid WARN() when unbinding an event channelWhen unbinding a user event channel, the related handler might becalled a last time in case the kernel was built withCONFIG_DEBUG_SHIRQ. This might cause a WARN() in the handler.Avoid that by adding an "unbinding" flag to struct user_event whichwill short circuit the handler.
